talk_paragraph.talk_question: <html>{ui_string:1200001}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200002}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200003}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200004}</html>
<html>{ui_string:1200005}</html>

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>(I'm not looking forward to it at all)</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Elf Guard Basha$
Huhuhu I just found my piece of paper.
Don't be surprised! My plan is...!
<html>$Butler and Master$</html>

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>What has that got to do with the problem?!</html>
<html>Please explain it in a way that I can understand.</html>
<html>But I felt sympathy for Rubinart in all the stories I've read so far!</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Elf Guard Basha$
My plan is to find a story which is about the cool Red Dragon, not the funny Red Dragon!!

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>It doesn't solve the problem by its roots...</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Elf Guard Basha$
Hmm? It's just as it is. Find a story where the Red Dragon appears to be serious and cool since Citridel has only been reading funny stories so far.

$Elf Guard Basha$
What? The root of the problem? Then how do you suppose Citridel can get better?

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>I think your method is even worse. </html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Elf Guard Basha$
Of course that won't work!

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Wait a minute, I'm the one who'll be doing all the work here?! </html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Elf Guard Basha$
No way. Then let's take a bet. {user_nick}, if you find the Red Dragon story and show it to Citridel, you'll see her recover overnight. If that doesn't work and your method works, I'll concede defeat.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>(There are too many points to argue about.)</html>
<html>(You said you're not a coward anymore...)</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Elf Guard Basha$
Well, I can't go anywhere because of my guard duties.
Besides, the records about the Red Dragon are at the Passage of Broken Recollections. How can I go to a dangerous place like that…

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>(I'm tired of arguing. I should just go.) </html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Elf Guard Basha$
{user_nick}, I know you want to help Citridel too!
(Basha's eyes are shining)

$Elf Guard Basha$
I knew it! Ever so dependable and trustworthy {user_nick}!!
(That sounds like a catchline in an advertisement... I should get going… To the Passage of Broken Recollections)

${user_nick}$
(You browse through the old books but there are surprisingly not many books about the Red Dragon… As you feel disappointed about it, you see a book entitled [Graces of the Respectable Master Rubinart]... and you pick it up.)

$The Book$
The kindness Master Rubinart has shown me is beyond anyone's imagination. I'm ready to give up my life and my soul for my master, even if he may be an evil dragon.

$The Book$
It all began when he moved in to this cave near the palace, leaving his tiny room in the castle...

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
Wahhh! I can finally breathe!! That human room was so suffocating!
How can the humans live in such tiny rooms?

$Knight Feder$
It was an extremely large room... but I guess it was still too small for you. You were the one who polished this cave so you can use it in any way you want.

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
Awesome. I can go straight up to the palace from here too. Not bad.
So you managed to get such a good spot from the fussy knight family eh, Feder? Not bad!

$Knight Feder$
Yes. They are dependable allies. But this cave was needed for your discipline. I have already received many complaints that your irregular life pattern is laxing the discipline of the entire palace. Your breakfasts are usually lunches, am I right?

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
There could be some days when a dragon eats only two meals a day... Wait a minute, are you trying to say that since you managed to get this cave for me from those conceited humans, you want me to change my life pattern in return?

$Knight Feder$
Of course. That's the least you could do. So I've specially got you a butler to help you out.

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
What kind of a dragon keeps a human butler?!
Ah... why did this cave belong to those obnoxious humans... So, where's the butler? How come you're here with Elizabeth alone?

$Knight Feder$
The butler... fell ill when he heard the news that he would be serving a dragon.

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
……This is not a joke, is it?
This isn't funny...

$Princess Elizabeth$
It could be stressful to think that you'd be serving a dragon. Why don't you go and show him that you're not dangerous?

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
I have to do that for moving in here too? Gee, aren't the butlers supposed to come and greet me first? Hmph, anyway I got it.

$The Book$
That's how Master Rubinart came all the way to my humble house himself.

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
…What?! You rolled down a cliff and broke your legs while you were getting some mushrooms for my dinner? You can't walk anymore?? You've become bedridden just because of a few broken bones...

$Butler Gershel$
I have nothing to say, Master Rubinart! The fallen leaves in the mountains made it more slippery... I should have been more careful... But my body is already aged... I've served countless great knights from the past so I was trying to serve you with my heart and soul too, but...

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
I don't need a butler so just concentrate on getting well. This is like a joke...

$Butler Gershel$
It is my duty to serve you since I've been ordered by His Majesty! I can still do my butler tasks on a wheelchair. As for my legs... I'll... I'll make sure I'll recover them with whatever means!!

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
…(He claps like he thought of something)
Hmm, so you want a healthy body with whatever means and you want to keep your job as a butler?

$Butler Gershel$
Th-that's right.

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
And you're not uncomfortable being a butler for a dragon, are you?

$Butler Gershel$
Of course not. It is the duty of a butler to serve his master wholeheartedly no matter who he is.

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
Great. Then how about this…? Although you may become a little ugly... (Whispers)

$Butler Gershel$
Hmm?! Are you serious? If it's something like that... I'm up for it!
Rather than waiting for months for my legs to recover, I shall just...!!

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
(Rubinart's smile looks evil)
You said that yourself! Don't forget! And don't regret!
It's a good thing that you're still healthy apart from your bones...

$The Book$
Master Rubinart gave me some pills, and I fell asleep after taking them...

$The Book$
(Huh?! That's it? Wait, there are some pages at the back but they're so tattered I can't read what's on them... What should I do...)

$The Book$
(Wait a minute... Isn't the ogre living further inside this place called Butler Gershel too? Could he be...)

$The Book$
(I should try asking him! He could be the Gershel who wrote this book!)

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Do you know this book? (Show him the book) </html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Butler Gershel$
Phew, you're so strong. I've fought with you several times but I can't win a strong adventurer like you... My old body is shaking now. It's a relief that you're not a thief.

$Butler Gershel$
This is... Oh, this was written by me! But the pages behind are... Tsk tsk. Small monsters must have torn them away...
So you want to know more about what happens next?

$Butler Gershel$
I see. All right, I'll tell you the story. (Gershel opens his mouth and…the story continues)

$Knight Feder$
…(He is staring at Rubinart and the huge monster next to him like he's stupefied and angry at the same time)
So you've made Gershel into a giant ogre? Are you insane, Rubinart?!

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
You sent this butler to me. Why are you angry about it?
Besides, Gershel agreed too. Didn't you, Gershel?

$Butler Gershel$
Haha that's right. Thanks to my ogre body, I'm having an easier time maintaining this cave too.
I'm much stronger now and my old body feels more energetic. Of course, my legs have healed long ago.

$Butler Gershel$
I'm fine with this body because it makes the humans more obedient when I tell them to do things.
I get a shock sometimes when I unknowingly act like a real ogre, but that has made the other ogres feel a brotherly connection with me. It was touching when they asked me to teach them manners.

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
You heard that.
I didn't live long for nothing. Good for me, good for him, good for everyone.

$Knight Feder$
…But still... This is absurd. How can you turn a human into a monster and order him around! (Feder looks repelled) Is there any way to turn him into a human again?

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
Of course there is, but he'll have his old body back and his brittle bones will break easily too.

$Butler Gershel$
Oh Your Majesty, I thank you for your concern but I don't wish to return to my old body that used to break down every now and then.
Since I already gained this new body, I want to live the rest of my days serving my master and teaching manners to other ogres.

$Knight Feder$
…If that's your wish…(But Feder still looks like he doesn't understand)
All right. But Rubinart, don't ever do this again! I can't let you do such a thing to someone who's alive.

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
Erm... all right.

$Knight Feder$
(Feder left)

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
He didn't need to be that angry...

$Butler Gershel$
Feder is a kind man. Maybe he thinks what happened to me is similar to nasty magic or a curse.

$Red Dragon Rubinart$
Well, Feder didn't live that long to see how the world works anyway.
Tell me anytime when you're sick of that ogre body. I'll lift the spell from you.

$Butler Gershel$
Haha how can I be sick of a healthy body? (Gershel smiles politely)

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>So that's why you beat me up without mercy whenever I come here...</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Butler Gershel$
That's how I got this body. It looks like I won't even die unless the spell is lifted.
But I have no wish to rest yet. There are many trainee butler ogres that I need to teach and I want this cave to be preserved for as long as possible. A cave where a dragon lived in is a valuable historic site.

$Butler Gershel$
Haha, one of the side effects I have after getting this body is that all the humans look the same.
If I see one, I attack first. I don't know when a filthy robber might come... But for you, {user_nick}, you're Master Rubinart's friend so it would be easy for you to defeat me.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Okay... (I should take the book back now...)</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Butler Gershel$
Haha, you're young and strong so you can take a few blows from me!
Please tell the others that the reason why the scary ogre in the cave fights is only to chase the robbers away.

$Butler Gershel$
I need to clean up the mess created from the fighting so I'll take my leave now.
(Gershel politely bows)

$Elf Guard Basha$
Argh... How can this happen!! (Basha is shaking)

$Elf Guard Basha$
You're finally here!! But it's too late... (Basha's shoulders droop)

$Elf Guard Basha$
Yes, she collapsed.

$Elf Guard Basha$
That created a fuss. I've never seen the Elder so flustered.
The guard captain was scolded too, and it was crazy. A few humans with medical knowledge had to come too...

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>Of course, work and rest should go hand in hand. </html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Elf Guard Basha$
So while you were gone, Citridel received all the medical help and took a good rest.
Now she's fine. She's talking sense too. Phew... it really must be that your method worked…

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>It's a relief that you know at least now.</html>
<html>If you followed what I said from the beginning...</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Elf Guard Basha$
This is the first time we were so busy...
Citridel must have been stressed out more since she's with the Elder...
I feel sorry for not taking care of her sooner as her senior...

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>(The two of them really don't get along…)</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Elf Guard Basha$
Well, that made the King and the Elder really silent though.
But rumour has it that they still quarrel in a soft voice...
Is it because they are male Elves? They sure have a lot of energy. They just don't get tired of fighting with each other.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>(I felt more sorry for her than find her a nuisance)</html>
<html>(Can't we do something about those who caused this…)</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Elf Guard Basha$
…By the way, Citridel wanted to say sorry when you were here.
She said she must have been a nuisance to you...
<html>$Quest Completed$</html>

$Elf Guard Basha$
I should take a good care of Citridel from now on.
I'll tie her hands and legs and throw her into her bed when I think she needs to get some rest.
I'll make sure this doesn't happen again. Though it's only by a few days, I'm her senior! (Basha looks determined)

journal.title: Butler and Master 1
journal.contents:
Talk to Elf Guard Basha to find a way to save Citridel.

Anu Arendel (Forest of New Moon Entrance) - Elf Guard Basha

journal.title: Butler and Master 2
journal.contents:
Basha's plan is to find a story with a serious and cool Red Dragon and make Citridel read it. Though you don't understand why this would work, Basha firmly believes it would. Give up persuading Basha and find the book.

Anu Arendel (Forest of Little Shadows) - Passage of Broken Recollections (Bookcase)
journal.destination: Find the book at the Passage of Broken Recollections
journal.todo_msg: Find the story at the Passage of Broken Recollections.

journal.title: Butler and Master 3
journal.contents:
You have found the story about Rubinart's encounter with Butler Gershel!
Maybe Rubinart will be a cool dude here. Listen to the story from Gershel himself.

Anu Arendel (Forest of Little Shadows) - Passage of Broken Recollections (Butler Gershel)
journal.todo_msg: Listen to Butler Gershel's story after defeating him.

journal.title: Butler and Master 4
journal.contents:
Talk to Elf Guard Basha to find a way to save Citridel.

Anu Arendel (Forest of New Moon Entrance) - Elf Guard Basha
journal.todo_msg: You have heard the story from Gershel. Talk to Elf Guard Basha.
